## Problem 1

Creating a class to represent rational numbers

#part a:

Setting constructor
```{r}
#' Rational class
#' 
#'Defining a class object that'll take in two integer inputs, one for the numerator and one for the denominator. This will be used to return a rational number given the input.
#'
#'
#' @return rational number
#' 
setClass("rational",
          slots = c(numerator = "numeric",
                    denominator = "numeric")
)
```

Setting Validity checker
```{r}
setValidity("rational",function(input){
  if (input@denominator == 0){
    stop(paste("@denominator = ", object@denominator, "needs to be nonzero integer"))
  }
  return(TRUE)
})
```

Show method
```{r}
setMethod("show","rational",
          function(object) {
            cat("Numerator :")
            str(object@numerator)
            cat("\n")
            cat("Denominator :")
            str(object@denominator)
            cat("\n")
            return(invisible(object))
})
```

Simplify method
```{r}
setMethod
```
